7389 : Compared to San d'Oria, with its legendary orders of knights, or Windurst, with its ancient institutes of magic, Bastok is still but a newborn nation.

7391 : Innovative and adaptable Humes make up more than half the population of Bastok.

7710 : Welcome to the auction house. Do you have any questions about our establishment?
7711 : What do you want to know? What is the auction house? How are auctions run? Are there any fees? Are there any limits? How do you check up on merchandise? How do you remove an item? My Sales Status list is full! Nothing right now.
7712 : Auction houses can be found in all of Vana'diel's major cities. Here adventurers gather to bid on battle spoils, unwanted items, old armor...almost anything.
7713 : Currently, the auction houses in Bastok, San d'Oria, Windurst, and Jeuno all work independently. Therefore, prices differ from city to city.
7714 : Adventurers may use any auction house regardless of nationality.
7715 : The first adventurer to bid at or above the asking price will automatically purchase the product.
7716 : Once put up for auction, merchandise will remain there for a maximum of thirty weeks Vana'diel time (nine-and-a-half days Earth time).
7717 : If merchandise does not sell within this time limit, it will be returned to the seller's current residence.
7718 : Transaction fees are proportional to the amount for which an item is put up on auction. The method of calculating this fee is different for single items and stackable items.
7719 : A transaction fee is collected when any merchandise is put up for auction. This fee is nonrefundable.
7720 : The International Auction House Committee, or IAHC, has declared that a maximum of seven items may be put up for auction at one time.
7721 : However, the IAHC has recently removed the limit to how many items one may purchase.
7722 : A small amount of time is required before new merchandise appears on our bid list.
7723 : Once an item appears on your Sales Status list, it may not immediately appear on the bid list. If you do not see your item on the bid list, try looking again at a later time.
7724 : If you would like to withdraw an item from an auction, you must travel to the auction house, and select Stop Sale from the Sales Status menu.
7725 : To remove an item from your Sales Status list, you must visit an auction counter to acknowledge the sale or return of your merchandise.
7726 : Otherwise, previously sold or returned items will fill up your list and prevent you from selling any more merchandise.
7727 : At any auction counter, open the Sales Status menu and acknowledge the transaction to clear it from the list.
7728 : Press the confirm button to remove any transaction colored yellow (sold) or red (returned).

7806 : What do you wish to know about? Nothing. Conquests. Conquest results. Donating crystals. Conquest points. The effects of controlling regions. Regions controlled by other nations. Regions under beastman control.
7807 : All three nations are striving daily to put more regions under their control. This is what we call conquests. You can take part in it and serve your country by defeating enemies while you have Signet cast on you.
7808 : Each region comprises several areas, and the nation that rids those areas of the most monsters gains control of the region.
7809 : Nations receive goods and resources from regions under their control.
7810 : So, the more regions we control, the richer our nation becomes.
7811 : Border guards are also placed in outposts within regions under our control. They are there to cast Signet on adventurers like yourself.
7812 : Once you have your nation's Signet, you will be able to acquire crystals from enemies you defeat.
7813 : Not only that, but you will also receive conquest points. You get more conquest points if you defeat enemies in regions that are not under your nation's control. These points can be used to purchase items from guards like myself.
7814 : So you see...conquests benefit nations and adventurers alike. We expect you to do your best to serve your country.
7815 : You can see the current state of conquests by selecting Region Info from the main menu. Conquest results in all regions are regularly recalculated, so you may want to check them from time to time.
7816 : Shops in our city will be selling different items according to our conquest rank. The Troupe Valeriano will also visit the nation that finishes first and bring a little joy to its citizens.
7817 : You can donate crystals to your nation once you achieve rank 2. Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.
7818 : We would like you to donate crystals to your nation from now on. Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.
7819 : You can acquire crystals by defeating enemies while you have your nation's Signet. Having Signet cast on you is also the only way of taking part in conquests.
7820 : Rank points will be awarded to you for each crystal you donate, and you may be offered new missions as your rank goes up.
7821 : You also receive rank points for completing missions. Complete missions and take part in conquests to raise your rank and serve your country.
7822 : You are awarded conquest points when you defeat monsters while you are taking part in conquests. Select "Region Info" from the menu to check your current number of conquest points.
7823 : You can purchase items from guards like myself with your conquest points, but be warned that the number of points you spend will be subtracted from your current total.
7824 : When conquest results are announced, you will be told which country controls the region you are in at that time. Sometimes regions may become neutral, or beastmen may even gain control of regions.
7825 : If we gain control of a region, border guards will be placed at its outposts to help adventurers like you.
7826 : Merchants will also be placed there, and goods from that region will find their way to the local shops here.
7827 : Gaining control of regions is the basic principle behind conquests. We need each of you to do your best, and bring our nation to the top of the ranks.
7828 : Of course, sometimes we lose regions to other nations...so we must try to take them back before the next conquest results are announced.
7829 : As an incentive, we will award you with more conquest points for defeating monsters in those regions.
7830 : But if we are allied with another nation, you will only be awarded the regular rate for defeating monsters in our allies' regions. On the other hand, we will award you with more points for fighting in the top-ranked nation's regions.
7831 : Our paramount concern lies in the beastmen gaining control of our regions. If too many of us are defeated in a region, the beastmen will gain control of it.
7832 : If this happens, not only is it a great blow to our pride, but you will be unable to acquire any crystals in that region.
7833 : The beastmen are a menace to all nations. If they rise to power, we must all unite and drive those vile creatures from that region.

8395 : <Match #> Entry period begins:  Briefing begins:
8396 : I apologize, but your level is too low to participate in an official Brenner match.
8397 : Official matches are scheduled to begin at the following times: Match 1: # Match 2:  Match 3:
8398 : Teleportation to the Isle is free of charge, but a participation fee of # gil is required before each match.
8399 : Travel to the Isle? Yes. Not yet.
8400 : What would you like to know about? Basic rules. Official/private matches. Flammen-Brenner. Flamme. Match score. Petras and quarrying. Sprint. KO. Return.
8401 : The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:
8402 : First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of Flammen-Brenner.
8403 : At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with Flamme, or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.
8404 : Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.
8405 : The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.
8406 : The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.
8407 : If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The match score section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.
8408 : Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.
8409 : You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.
8410 : No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.
8411 : The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed # members, or if there are fewer than # members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.
8412 : Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The Master of Ceremonies (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.
8413 : LS Liga is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.
8414 : A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.
8415 : The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.
8416 : If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.
8417 : After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.
8418 : Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.
8419 : In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.
8420 : Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.
8421 : Like Ballista, quarry (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up Petras and temporary items.
8422 : However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can trade a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.
8423 : Sprint cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the scout ability cannot be used in Brenner.
8424 : Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.
8425 : The sprint (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.
8426 : In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.
8427 : In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.

9861 : This is the basic care plan for your chocobo. Under this plan, we will provide for your chocobo's most fundamental needs.
9862 : You can choose to give your chocobo a long rest. This will revitalize its energy and accelerate its recovery from injury or illness.
9863 : We can take your chocobo out on a walk through the safe areas of town. This should improve its physical condition.
9864 : Listening to music will make your chocobo a more refined creature, and should improve its mental condition.
9865 : Exercising alone will improve your chocobo's strength, but will have a slightly negative effect on its mental condition.
9866 : Exercising in a group will improve your chocobo's stamina, but will have a slightly negative effect on its mental condition.
9867 : Interacting with children will improve your chocobo's intelligence, but will have a slightly negative effect on its physical condition.
9868 : Interacting with other chocobos will improve your chocobo's receptivity, but will have a slightly negative effect on its physical condition.
9869 : You can earn some money by having your chocobo deliver packages for the guilds.
9870 : Carrying heavy loads will improve its physical condition, but will inflict a certain amount of stress on the animal.
9871 : You can exhibit your chocobo to the public. We will provide you with a monetary token of gratitude for this service.
9872 : Interacting with the public will improve its mental condition, but will inflict a certain amount of stress on the animal.
9873 : You can send your chocobo to deliver official messages. The nation will compensate you for your services.
9874 : Carrying someone on its back for a long period of time will build strength in your chocobo's legs, but will place some strain on the animal.

9876 : Digging for treasure will improve your chocobo's intelligence, but will place some strain on the animal and may decrease its stamina.
9877 : Your chocobo can even appear in plays. This will require your chocobo to perform simple acts and will improve its receptivity.

9981 : What would you like to ask about? The Vana'diel Chocobo Society. Time required. Chocobo attributes. Care schedule. Caring for your chocobo. Feed. Abilities and personality. Retirement. Matchmaking. Calling chocobos in the field. Items. Lost chicks. Nothing.
9982 : Just let me know if you ever get curious!
9983 : The Vana'diel Chocobo Society, or VCS for short, is an international organization designed to train and dispatch chocogirls and chocoguys to stables across Vana'diel.
9984 : They provide courses on practical chocobo riding and the proper ways to care for a chocobo, as well as working to improve the treatment of chocobos from here to Aht Urhgan.
9985 : Anyone can join as long as they love chocobos. The VCS will help you with anything you need.
9986 : Chicks hatch from eggs, grow into young chocobos, and finally mature.
9987 : They grow much faster than people do. Usually it takes about 1 month (Earth time) before you can ride your chocobo.
9988 : The chocobo's traits are determined by the way in which you care for your animal. Without proper planning, you won't be able to raise the type of chocobo that you want.
9989 : But don't worry, because you have us to help! We're all in this together!
9990 : Ask about which attribute? Strength. Endurance. Discernment. Receptivity. Energy. Affection. Satisfaction. Nothing.
9991 : Strength is a term used to describe the chocobo's leg power. The more strength a chocobo has, the faster it will be able to run. Rental chocobos have been raised with an emphasis on this attribute.
9992 : Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as Physical attributes.
9993 : Endurance is a term used to describe the chocobo's stamina. If your chocobo has high endurance, you will be able to ride it for a long period of time.
9994 : Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as Physical attributes.
9995 : Discernment is a must for anyone who wants their chocobo to learn new abilities. You may want to consider raising this attribute if you are interested in digging for treasure.
9996 : Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as Mental attributes.
9997 : Receptivity is a term used to describe the chocobo's sensitivity when dealing with others. You can foster receptivity in your chocobo by giving it lots of opportunities to communicate with other chocobos.
9998 : Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as Mental attributes.
9999 : Energy is a term used to describe the amount of power the chocobo needs to stay active for the day. If your chocobo has a lot of energy, care plans are more likely to be successful and you can provide more direct care for your chocobo.
10000 : You can restore your chocobo's energy by feeding it, so remember not to skip out on feeding time after a demanding schedule!
10001 : Affection is the most important attribute of all. Your care schedule will fall flat if you don't show your chocobo proper affection!
10002 : You can raise your chocobo's affection by feeding it greens and caring for it on a regular basis.
10003 : If you really want to raise your chocobo's affection quickly, you can give it %, but I can't recommend doing so unless absolutely necessary.
10004 : Satisfaction is a term used to describe how full or hungry your chocobo is. If your chocobo is full, it will gain a lot of energy before the next day.
10005 : However, when the chocobo is very hungry, its energy will hardly recover at all and its affection will rapidly decrease.
10006 : What would you like to ask about? What is a care schedule? Basic care. Resting. Taking a walk. Listening to music. Exercising alone. Exercising in a group. Interacting with children. Interacting with chocobos. Carrying packages. Exhibiting to the public. Delivering messages. Digging for treasure. Acting in a play. Nothing.
10007 : A care schedule is a series of plans that you set up for your chocobo so that we can take care of it while you are away.
10008 : How you want us to care for your chocobo each day is completely up to you.
10009 : You can register up to four plans at once, each for up to 7 days (Earth time).
10010 : When you come to check on your chocobo, we will give you a report on the results. You should listen closely to the report and use it as reference when deciding on a new schedule.
10011 : With the basic care plan, we will provide the minimum level of care for your chocobo. This plan is the most stable, and your chocobo will probably not experience any sudden changes.
10012 : The basic care plan is good for those who don't want their chocobo's traits to change much or are still unsure of what kind of schedule to choose.
10013 : You can select the basic care plan the moment you start raising your chocobo.
10014 : The rest plan's name speaks for itself. We will give your chocobo a rest in order to restore its energy and cure any status abnormalities.
10015 : However, your chocobo will not be able to eat any food you give it during the plan, because it will be in a deep sleep.
10016 : We can take your chocobo for a walk in town to improve its physical attributes of strength and endurance. However, it will have a negative effect on its mental attributes of discernment and receptivity.
10017 : Listening to music will improve your chocobo's mental attributes of discernment and receptivity. However, it will have a negative effect on its physical attributes of strength and endurance.
10018 : Exercising alone will significantly improve your chocobo's strength. On the other hand, its mental attributes will markedly decrease.
10019 : If the chocobo is strong, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo is weak, then you shouldn't push it too hard.
10020 : Exercising with chocobos will build your animal's endurance. On the other hand, its mental attributes will decrease.
10021 : If the chocobo has high endurance, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo's endurance is low, then you shouldn't push it too hard.

10023 : However, this plan will have a negative effect on the chocobo's physical attributes, as no strenuous exercise is involved.
10024 : If the chocobo has good discernment, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo does not have good discernment, then you shouldn't push it too hard.

10026 : But because the focus is on communication and not exercise, this plan will have a negative effect on the chocobo's physical attributes.
10027 : If the chocobo has good receptivity, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo does not have good receptivity, then you shouldn't push it too hard.

10029 : The downside is that your chocobo's mental attributes, energy, and affection will decrease. You must care well for your chocobo, or you might find yourself getting cold treatment.

10031 : The downside is that your chocobo's physical attributes, energy, and affection will decrease. You must care well for your chocobo afterwards. Also, you will receive payment for this service.

10033 : However, this plan consumes quite a bit of your chocobo's energy, so you should feed it well to make up for it.

10039 : What would you like to ask about? A general explanation. Watching over your chocobo. Telling a story. Scolding. Competing. Taking a walk. Nothing.
10040 : In addition to setting the chocobo's schedule, you can also care directly for your chocobo whenever you like.
10041 : Caring for your chocobo will increase its affection for you.
10042 : On the other hand, a chocobo that receives too much care will lose energy more rapidly when engaging in activities. If you do nothing but care for your chocobo, it will become fatigued.
10043 : However, not caring enough for your chocobo will have a negative effect on your relationship, so it is important to find a balance.
10044 : You can watch over your chocobo whenever you like.
10045 : Your fond gaze can communicate even more than a touch and will not have a very tiring effect on the animal.
10046 : You can tell the chocobo a story you know. This will foster the animal's sensibilities.
10047 : I've heard that by listening to the story, the chocobo might even realize it has powers it never noticed before. (I've never seen it happen before, though...)
10048 : Sometimes your chocobo might start acting spoiled or refuse to do anything but sleep. In such times, you will need to firmly scold it.
10049 : This will shame the animal and have an effect on its receptivity.
10050 : Competing against other chocobos will cultivate your animal's ambitious spirit and is highly effective for bored chocobos.
10051 : You can take your chocobo out for a walk in the field. You will be able to choose more destinations as your chocobo grows.
10052 : I like to take the chocobo out often, too, but I'm sure it prefers going out with you.
10053 : Leaving the stables every once in a while allows your chocobo to experience new sights and sounds. Maybe you'll even discover something new together!
10054 : What would you like to know about? Why feeding is important. Vegetables. Wildgrasses. Carrots. Worms. Medicines. Pastes. Nothing.
10055 : Chocobos digest feed quickly, so they are often hungry.
10056 : However, they also restore energy at a rapid pace. If you do not feed your chocobo properly, it will be unable to restore enough energy.
10057 : The chocobo stables will provide your chocobo with the minimum amount of feed required for the animal to survive, but you need to provide more in order to ensure its healthy growth.
10058 : At the same time, feeding your chocobo too much can result in a stomachache. Remember to strike a balance with both the variety and quantity of feed you give to your animal!
10059 : Some types of feed have special effects, so it is important not to neglect your chocobo's diet if you want to raise a good chocobo.
10060 : There are different methods of acquiring these special types of feed, so be on the lookout for them!
10061 : Just trade the feed to an advanced chocobo trainer, and they will give it to your chocobo.
10062 : This is the standard variety of chocobo feed, among which % are most popular.
10063 : Chocobos also seem to enjoy % and %.
10064 : These greens are the most effective in satisfying a chocobo's hunger. Chocobos also enjoy the taste, which raises affection for their owner.
10065 : Wildgrasses are a type of medicinal herb. They do not taste very good, but are highly effective at curing status abnormalities.
10066 : %, for example, works well on wounds. So although they look similar to %, the effects are different.
10067 : In addition, % is effective for illness, and % for a stomachache. It's a good idea to remember which herb to use in each situation.
10068 : Carrots are high in nutrition, and will have an effect on the chocobo's strength and discernment.
10069 : %, for example, affect the chocobo's physical attributes, and % are good for its mental attributes. % are in a category of their own.
10070 : Remember, though, that the results are very slight, and keeping a good care schedule is a far more efficient way to alter your chocobo's attributes.
10071 : Using worms as feed can have a variety of effects. They might look disgusting, but their effectiveness is not to be ignored!
10072 : For example, % will dramatically increase your chocobo's affection, and % will restore its energy.
10073 : But watch out for the side effects... Give the chocobo a worm at the wrong time, and all your effort could come to nothing...
10074 : The most curious of all the worms is the %. At first it may not seem to have any effect, but looks are deceiving...
10075 : Medicines can cure a chocobo in the blink of an eye.
10076 : % will restore your chocobo's energy in full, making it easier to care for and ensuring that the care schedule goes smoothly.
10077 : % are effective for most status abnormalities, restoring instant health to your chocobo. Of course, you still need to continue caring for your chocobo so it can fully recover.
10078 : A potion can also help fill a chocobo's stomach, so they can be useful when you are short on feed.
10079 : Feed can be ground into paste for chicks to eat.
10080 : You can make paste yourself with some cooking skill. If you don't have enough cooking skill yourself, then you might want to ask a friend to make some for you.
10081 : Chicks can also eat regular feed, though.
10082 : Which would you like to ask about? Abilities. Temperament. Weather preferences. Nothing.
10083 : Your chocobo may learn useful abilities during the course of its life at the stables.
10084 : For example, Auto-Regen will increase the rate at which your chocobo restores energy. Such an ability is sure to come in handy in a variety of situations.
10085 : Your chocobo learns abilities by listening to your words, so if you know of any story that you think might interest the animal, you should tell it often.
10086 : But remember, your chocobo can't learn all of the abilities there are. It can only learn two...or at least, that's what I read.
10087 : The chocobo's temperament is determined when it is just a chick. Its temperament and attributes are somehow related, but I'm not really sure how.
10088 : Chocobos generally like sunny days, but they could grow to like other kinds of weather depending on how they are raised.
10089 : Chocobos pay attention to the air outside when they go on walks, and grow to prefer that type of weather because of the memories.
10090 : Make the animal's schedule around its preferred weather days, and plans are more likely to succeed. However, if the chocobo has a favored type of weather, it also dislikes certain conditions, creating a weak point to watch for.
10091 : You can choose to retire your chocobo at any time after it has fully matured.
10092 : After retirement, the VCS will take up caring for the chocobo where you left off, so you need not worry about its welfare.
10093 : When your chocobo retires, you will receive %. Be sure not to lose it.
10094 : You can use the % to register your chocobo to call in the field or for matchmaking purposes after retirement. All you need to do is trade it to a VCS member.
10095 : The empty stall created after your animal retires can be used for raising other chocobos, so if you happen to come across another egg, you can bring it here to start all over again!
10096 : When your chocobo is mature enough, you can breed it with another chocobo. If the chocobo lays an egg, the chick will inherit the traits of its parents.
10097 : You will need % and % if you want to breed your chocobo. Apparently, you also need some kind of ticket that they sell at the stables in Upper Jeuno.
10098 : You can ask one of the VCS members to issue you a chococard, or if your chocobo is already retired, just trade them %.
10099 : I don't really know that much about it, but you should probably try matching your chocobo up with several different animals and seeing what the results are.
10100 : When your chocobo is mature enough, you can call it in the field using %.
10101 : You need to let a member of the VCS know which chocobo you want to respond to your call, because they must choose a saddle that fits your chocobo's attributes.
10102 : That also means that when your chocobo's attributes change or it learns a new ability, you should probably let the VCS member know, too.
10103 : When you want to register a retired chocobo to respond to your call in the field, trade % to a VCS member.
10104 : Also, the %'s power will grow weak after you've used it several times.
10105 : If this happens, just trade it to a VCS member and they will give you a new one for a fee.
10106 : What would you like to ask about? %. Chococards. %. Nothing.
10107 : % proves that you are your chocobo's caretaker.
10108 : With this card, you can register a retired chocobo to respond to your call in the field or get a chococard for matchmaking.
10109 : If you lose it, you won't be able to get another one, so keep it in a safe place!
10110 : You can use % to call your chocobo in the field to use as a mount.
10111 : The more you use it, the weaker it will get, so eventually you will need to exchange it to a VCS member for a new one.
10112 : Only people who have been approved by the VCS President can get %, so good luck with that...
10113 : Chococards are documents that contain all the details about a chocobo's attributes and condition. They are divided into two types--one for each gender.
10114 : If you trade one to the person who's in charge of matchmaking, he'll introduce your animal to another chocobo.
10115 : Chococards contain information on the chocobo's attributes and condition at the time the card is issued, so be sure to get a new card before using this service or the match will be arranged based on out-of-date information.
10116 : If you want a chococard for a retired chocobo, then you must trade % to a VCS member.

11236 : What would you like to know? Why race chocobos, anyway? How do I register for a race? How do I prepare for a race? What are chocobucks? What kind of races are there? What are racing teams? Quit. Return.
11237 : Why not!? Our original plan was to establish locations across Vana'diel where people could test their birds' skills.
11238 : We felt that this would help us maintain breeder motivation, which in turn would ensure healthier, happier chocobos. A win-win situation, as we like to call it in the business.
11239 : However, as rumors of these new facilities began to leak out into the world, people began speculating about the possibility of officially sanctioned chocobo races...
11240 : The VCS could not ignore the voice of the masses, and it was not long before a meeting was held, a vote was taken, and the CRA was formed.
11241 : And that's why I'm here, trying to enlist you and other top breeders into our noble ranks.
11242 : Oh, and for our more seasoned veterans who feel there are no challenges left for them here at the track, the CRA has finished preparing a new race. And rumor has that it's a doozie!
11243 : First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.
11244 : Next, you must bring me either % or %. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.
11245 : As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.
11246 : Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.
11247 : Once you have registered your chocobo and entered it in a competition, the CRA will proceed in assigning it a licensed jockey.
11248 : Before each race you will be given the opportunity to give the jockey specific orders on his or her riding style.
11249 : In addition to these orders, you can also provide the jockey with items to use while riding, as well as equipment to improve your chocobo's performance.
11250 : Before a race, you can also check the strengths and weaknesses of the other participating chocobos. It is recommended that you use this data when deciding on what orders to give, or which items to equip.
11251 : Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint chocobucks.
11252 : Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.
11253 : Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.
11254 : There are two main types of races.
11255 : The first type is called an official race. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.
11256 : Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.
11257 : You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.
11258 : However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.
11259 : The second type of race is called a free run. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match.
11260 : You must pay a fee in gil to participate in free runs, but you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance. You can join as many free runs as you wish in a single day (Earth time), but extra fees may be required for each additional race. (Stable hands have to make a living, too!)
11261 : The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.
11262 : Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.
11263 : Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.
11264 : In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.
11265 : You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.
11266 : Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).

11442 : Which saddle would you like to use? Lauan saddle. Ash saddle. Elm saddle. Brass saddle. Silver saddle. Mythril saddle. Grass saddle. Cotton saddle. Linen saddle. Rabbit hide saddle. Sheep leather saddle. Buffalo leather saddle. Quit.
11443 : A standard model, the lauan saddle will stabilize your chocobo's stride.
11444 : A standard model, the ash saddle will stabilize your chocobo's stride. It also increases your mount's endurance.
11445 : A standard model, the elm saddle will stabilize your chocobo's stride. It also increases your mount's endurance.
11446 : A bit on the hefty side, the brass saddle can be somewhat taxing on a chocobo's endurance. It compensates for this, however, by increasing the bird's strength.
11447 : A bit on the hefty side, the silver saddle can be somewhat taxing on a chocobo's endurance. It compensates for this, however, by increasing the bird's strength.
11448 : A bit on the hefty side, the mythril saddle can be somewhat taxing on a chocobo's endurance. It compensates for this, however, by increasing the bird's strength.
11449 : This lightweight grass saddle can create a marked improvement in physical performance. However, a chocobo will require some degree of discernment to reap its benefits.
11450 : This lightweight cotton saddle can create a marked improvement in physical performance. However, a chocobo will require some degree of discernment to reap its benefits.
11451 : This lightweight linen saddle can create a marked improvement in physical performance. However, a chocobo will require some degree of discernment to reap its benefits.
11452 : Crafted from the finest rabbit hide, this saddle can improve physical performance, but only for chocobos with at least moderate receptivity.
11453 : Crafted from the finest sheep leather, this saddle can improve physical performance, but only for chocobos with at least moderate receptivity.
11454 : Crafted from the finest buffalo leather, this saddle can improve physical performance, but only for chocobos with at least moderate receptivity.

11519 : Greetings, and welcome to the General Information Center.
11520 : What can I help you with? Racing teams. Results of previous races. Racetrack directions. Races. Racing. Chocobetting. I'm fine, thanks.

11523 : Current Standings Team San d'Oria: [Dominant/Major/Minor/Minimal/???] Team Bastok: [Dominant/Major/Minor/Minimal/???] Team Windurst: [Dominant/Major/Minor/Minimal/???]

11525 : Last Week's Standings Team San d'Oria: # Team Bastok: # Team Windurst: #
11526 : Helping your team into first will give you certain advantages over your rivals! That should give you something to strive for!
11527 : What would you like to know about? The promenade. Chocobet centers. The grandstand. Portals. Guides. Nothing for now.
11528 : Shops, as well as attendants to assist you in siging up your chocobo for a race, are located on the promenade.
11529 : It can be found just south of here.
11530 : The promenade itself is split into eastern and western halves, both of which house all of the same facilities. Be sure to stop by and have a look when you get a chance.
11531 : Attendants at the chocobet centers are there to assist you with acquiring %, as well as collecting your winnings.
11532 : There are a total of five centers readily available for your convenience, each of which are located near the transportation portals. There are two to the east and west of here, and one just to the north.
11533 : All chocobet centers are capable of providing the same services.
11534 : The grandstand faces the racetrack itself, and allows spectators to sit and enjoy the races in comfort.
11535 : To get there, just follow the red carpet all the way through the betting area. You can't miss it.
11536 : The standard admission fee is # gil. Patrons who possess % may enter free of charge.
11537 : % will be provided anytime you purchase % or sign up for a race.
11538 : Your % will become invalid as soon as you leave the grandstand. Reentry will require you to pay an additional admission fee.
11539 : This racetrack is equipped with portals to transport our patrons to any of the three nations, as well as Jeuno and Al Zahbi.
11540 : As you can see, we are regularly visited by a multitude of race fans, breeders, and jockeys from every realm imaginable. We have therefore relegated each portal to a single destination in an attempt to avoid congestion.
11541 : For the same reasons, we ask that visitors refrain from setting up bazaars while here. Violators of this rule will be severely punished. Your cooperation is appreciated.
11542 : Guides can be found throughout the premises waiting to assist you.
11543 : They can help by transporting you to the location of your choice.
11544 : This service is provided free of charge, so please don't hesitate to make use of it.
11545 : What would you like to know about? Racing teams. Race rules. Race types. Victory points. Race Progression. That's about it.
11546 : A race chocobo's owner or jockey may join one of the three racing teams by registering at the appropriate VCS branch.
11547 : Each nation's Team Victory Points are the sum total of all of its members' Solo Victory Points. The Team Victory Point totals are then used to determine the overall weekly standings.
11548 : In order to race your chocobo here, we ask that you please affiliate yourself first with one of the three teams.
11549 : For details, please check with your local CRA racing center.
11550 : The races held here are almost identical to the official and private races held at the other racetracks.
11551 : What distinguishes our races is the fact that victories here qualify you to collect larger cash purses, as well as Victory Points.
11552 : Eligibility to participate in the higher-level races will require a certain number of Solo Victory Points.
11553 : Depending on a team's weekly standings, its members may suffer certain eligibility restrictions. At the same time, they may also be privy to certain benefits.
11554 : The teams in second and third place will have the advantage of being allowed more entry positions in any given race, while those of the leading team are restricted.
11555 : The leading team will, however, be granted the privilege of selecting higher-quality saddles for their race chocobos.
11556 : The CRA reserves the right to impose a handicap system when it is determined that the gap in skill between chocobos is simply too great to make for a fair race.
11557 : In such an event, the less endowed of the chocobos will be granted certain enhancing effects, such as Haste or Refresh.
11558 : Whether handicaps will be enforced or not will be determined after signups are complete. Make sure to keep an eye on your chocobo's settings.
11559 : Each race title will include a code, such as C4. This code is the race grade.
11560 : For example, a C4 Chocobo Race would indicate a typical grade 4 race.
11561 : We have four race grades, ranging from C4 to C1. The lower the number, the higher the grade. This, of course, means larger entry fees, but also more prize money.
11562 : No matter which race you enter, upon completion you will be prevented from joining any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time). Higher-grade races carry larger purses, so most racers like to use their opportunities to go after those.
11563 : Solo Victory Points will be awarded to you every race, depending on how well you finish.
11564 : As your Solo Victory Points accumulate, your chocobo will be able to gain entry to high-grade races.
11565 : Should a racer return to the circuit after an absence of four weeks or more, the CRA will be forced to deduct a number of Solo Victory Points.
11566 : Only on the rarest of occasions will such penalties be imposed. However, there are some races in which you will be unable to participate if you do not have a certain amount of Solo Victory Points in your possession.
11567 : Also, obtaining Solo Victory Points will also grant your nation Team Victory Points.
11568 : The three teams are in constant competition with one another, and a weekly ranking system is in place based on Team Victory Point totals.
11569 : As a team climbs up in rank, certain benefits will follow. You may see new items available for purchase with chocobucks, preferential treatment at the races, and so on.
11570 : Keep in mind that should you change your team affiliation, you will be forced to forfeit any accumulated Solo Victory Points.
11571 : We have a total of four races that run in succession.
11572 : Each race has its own dedicated signup window. Here there will be four attendants ready to serve all your racing needs.
11573 : Even if the race registration at one window closes, registration for the next race will begin immediately at the neighboring window.
11574 : Races will be held one after the other, so you'll have plenty of chances to watch and bet. Sit back, relax, and enjoy!
11575 : What would you like to hear more about? Race preparations. Signup procedure. Collecting winnings. Signing up for another race. I'm fine, thanks.
11576 : There are a few facts that you should know before running in a race.
11577 : First of all, you absolutely must be affiliated with one of the three official racing teams. These, as you may already know, are San d'Oria, Bastok, and Windurst.
11578 : Secondly, it is required that your bird be registered as a race chocobo, for obvious reasons. No race chocobo, no race.
11579 : Thirdly, you will be responsible for providing your own items to be used during the race. The CRA leaves this to the racer's discretion...
11580 : All of these services can be provided at any racing center, but to facilitate the registration process it is recommended that you conduct all such affairs at the appropriate branch.
11581 : A racing fee is necessary to gain entry into a chocobo race. The racing center will inform you of the cost, so please be sure to pay when signing up for a race.
11582 : Also, when signing up to race, you will be able to choose a saddle, as well as the lane in which your chocobo will race.
11583 : There are multifarious saddles at the rider's disposal, each of which will affect your chocobo's conditioning. In addition, the types of saddles available will change depending on your team's current ranking.
11584 : There are a total of eight lanes, but general conditions for all of them are the same. Feel free to race in the lane of your choice.
11585 : Setting these options will complete the signup process. You will then be given %, which you will need to exchange later to collect any winnings.
11586 : In the event that you should lose or misplace your %, you will be unable to collect any prize money, chocobucks, or Victory Points that you may be entitled to. I cannot stress enough how important it is to hold on to it.
11587 : The races can be viewed from our grandstand area. Take a seat and cheer on your bird!
11588 : You will be eligible for prize money if your chocobo places either first, second, or third.
11589 : To collect, simply hand in the % you received during race signup at any signup center.
11590 : The amount of gil, chocobucks, and Victory Points you qualify to receive will be based upon your bird's placement.
11591 : You will lose the right to collect your winnings from a race exactly one week after that race has ended.
11592 : After participating in a race, your chocobo will be unable to join any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time).
11593 : This pertains only to races held here, and will not affect your eligibility for races held at any other racetracks.
11594 : We have implemented these restrictions here as to allow the greatest number of participants' entry into our races. Your patience and understanding are appreciated.
11595 : What would you like to ask? What is chocobetting? How do I bet? What are odds? When do I bet? How do I collect winnings? Nothing.
11596 : Chocobetting is a form of entertainment where bettors attempt to pick the two birds that will finish first and second in a race.
11597 : To make it a bit more interesting, the bettor can then wager on their picks in increments of 100 gil.
11598 : Should lady luck smile upon you and your picks hit, you can win prize money, the amount of which is determined by the odds for that race.
11599 : For example, let's say that you were to bet ten quills (1000 gil) on Entries No. 5 and No. 7.
11600 : And let's say that the toteboard showed the odds for the race at 110 gil. If your picks were to finish as the top two birds, you would be eligible to collect 1100 gil in winnings, for a total profit of 100 gil.
11601 : Of course, it goes without saying that should your picks not have the fortune of finishing in the top two places, you will receive absolutely no gil.
11602 : The gambler's fallacy is our mantra here at the racetrack! Remember, you are special! Let it ride!
11603 : To place a chocobet, you must obtain % from the chocobet center.
11604 : For any single %, a bettor may purchase up to 999 quills. Each quill costs 100 gil.
11605 : We highly recommend that you obtain information on the chocobos you will be betting on before purchasing your ticket. It is always good to know where your money is going.
11606 : Odds determine how much gil you will receive in winnings per quill on your chocobet ticket.
11607 : Winnings are calculated by taking the total monetary sum of all bets for any given pairing. For example, should ten bettors each place the same 100-quill (10,000 gil) chocobet, the total used to determine the winnings would be 100,000 gil.
11608 : It goes without saying that not all bettors will be winners. The money from losing bets is used to pay off the winners.
11609 : What this means is that if you place a bet on an unseemly chocobo pairing, or pick two birds without much money riding on them, and are fortunate enough to win, you can make quite a tidy sum.
11610 : Toteboards display the odds at both the chocobet center as well as the grandstand. Toteboards have eight columns with the number on top of each column representing one chocobo, and the number to the left of each column representing another. If your bet is for chocobos No. 2 and No. 5, check the #2 column to see how much a 2-5 bet will pay per quill.
11611 : The odds are constantly changing right up until the race begins. If the number of bets on a popular chocobo pairing keeps increasing, then consequently the odds will go down.
11612 : Even if you place a large bet early on, the odds may still change as time passes. So take your time and consider carefully.
11613 : Chocobets can be placed as soon as the signup period for a race has ended. The betting window will close several minutes before the race begins.
11614 : Make sure to get your bet in on time. Even if you are in the middle of placing a bet, it will be cancelled if you exceed the allowed time window by even a single second.
11615 : Once the race is finished, you can exchange your % at any chocobet center to collect your winnings.
11616 : Without % you will be unable to collect your winnings, so make sure not to lose it.
11617 : % is valid for up to one week (Earth time) after completion of the race for which it was purchased.
11618 : Should one week pass, we will be unable to accept the ticket, so it is always best to cash out as soon as possible.

11672 : You obtain %!
11673 : Greetings, and welcome to the Chocobo Racing Association's (CRA) [San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] branch. This service area is here to accommodate our more experienced and accomplished racers.
11674 : I am truly sorry [sir/ma'am], but we are unable to service your request here. This service area only caters to [San d'Orian/Bastokan/Windurstian] CRA Classic winners.
11675 : Registration for such an event can be carried out at the service areas for beginning and intermediate racers. Please speak to the attendants there for further assistance.
11676 : The organizing attendants in each location are as follows: [Southern San d'Oria: Alangriche/Bastok Mines: Jazgeh/Windurst Waters: Turumi-Byrumi] [Northern San d'Oria: Monteverle/Bastok Markets: Galienne/Windurst Port: Lhimo Keanyohn] [Port San d'Oria: Ramiene/Port Bastok: Salvador/Windurst Woods: Rungaga].
11677 : For beginning and intermediate races, you'll want to speak with [Alangriche/Jazgeh/Rungaga].
11678 : My apologies, [sir/ma'am], but it appears that you have yet to conduct all of the necessary processing at the service area for beginning and intermediate racers. Please speak to the attendants there for further assistance.
11679 : My apologies, [sir/ma'am], but it appears that you have yet to conduct all of the necessary processing at the service area for advanced and veteran racers. Please speak to the attendants there for further assistance.
11680 : Which would you like to hear about? CRA rationale behind veteran races. How do I register for a race? How do I prepare for a race? What are chocobucks? What kinds of races are there? What are racing teams? What about race opponents? Quit. Return.
11681 : With the establishment of the Chocobo Circuit and the introduction of chocobo races, the hidden talents of a number of chocobos across Vana'diel finally had a venue in which to come to fruition.
11682 : As the next step, the CRA recognized these rare and valuable talents, and developed a new, special kind of race to showcase them even more than before!
11683 : The Monster Races!
11684 : Without the interference of jockeys, breeders can now pit their chocobos head-to-head against a number of monster species in brutal, raw, no-holds-barred racing!
11685 : Even some of the CRA's very own best and brightest chocobos will be entering into these races geared specifically to our veteran clientele. What more thrilling way to spend a day at the races than to see Vana'diel's most elite chocobos competing against its most fiendish monsters!?
11686 : First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.
11687 : Next, you must bring me either % or %. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.
11688 : As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.
11689 : Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.
11690 : Since these races are geared towards our more veteran racers and will not make use of jockeys, all in-race conduct is based solely on the chocobos themselves. The CRA wants these races to be as pure as possible!
11691 : The same philosophy applies to the usage of items as well. Simply preset the items you wish for your chocobo to have at its disposal. It will use them as it sees fit based on real-time assessment of racing conditions.
11692 : Many breeders are distressed by these rules, but we assure you there is no need for concern. If your chocobo has progressed far enough in the Chocobo Circuit to even be participating in the Monster Races, it is a given that it has enough know-how to use its items wisely. Have faith in your bird.
11693 : Also, as with other races in the past, you will be able to check on the strengths and weaknesses of your opponents at this service area. Many breeders like to use this information for developing their race strategies, and we encourage you to do the same.
11694 : Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint chocobucks.
11695 : Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.
11696 : Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.
11697 : There are two main types of races.
11698 : The first type is called an official race. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.
11699 : Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.
11700 : You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.
11701 : However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.
11702 : The second type of race is called a free run. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match. In addition, you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance.
11703 : You are not able to sign up for free runs at this location. To do so, please visit the appropriate service area for beginning and intermediate racers. Thank you for your understanding.
11704 : The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.
11705 : Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.
11706 : Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.
11707 : In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.
11708 : You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.
11709 : Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).
11710 : Your opponents in the official monster races will be any of a host of beasts reared and trained by racing aficionado and announcer extraordinaire, Markovich.
11711 : We ensure all participating breeders that these monsters are in no way enhanced or engineered for racing excellence. The CRA has been adamant about maintaining race participants to as close to their natural state of being as possible.
11712 : Though each variety of monster does in fact possess characteristic abilities and traits. And they have undergone extensive training to optimize their use of these in races.
11713 : As with the chocobos, however, the monsters will be absent jockeys of any kind. It is possible, and expected, that they will often unleash their wild, animalistic instincts on the racetrack. Consider yourself warned.
11714 : In the spirit of drawing crowds, the CRA has also elected to place some of their finest birds on the racing roster as well. Breeders can also expect to see other superior-class chocobos taking part. It's going to take a lot more than just speed and endurance to win these races!
11715 : Finally, in the absence of jockeys, finish-line sensors will be employed. These devices will be attached to the contestants' ankles, or in the absence of ankles, some other such appropriate place.

12487 : Signet even helps you when not engaged in combat with an enemy. For example, it boosts the rate at which healing occurs while at rest. For all of these reasons and more, you should consider it essential to have Signet cast on you at all times.

12489 : There is more here than meats the eye! That was a joke... Anyway, this is a type of item known amongst adventurers as a meal. This meal in particular will temporarily enhance your attack power when eaten.
12490 : Whenever any type of meal is consumed, you will receive some such temporary status bonus. Naturally, different meals grant different types of bonuses.
12491 : For the most part, meat dishes will affect attack power. Conversely, seafood dishes generally enhance defense, and so on and so forth. Take care to select dishes best suited to your purpose.
12492 : One thing you should make note of, however, is that you cannot eat a meal while another meal's status bonus is still in effect. Your stomach would simply burst!
12493 : Hmmm, that's quite a lot to cover... Are you with me so far?
12494 : So far so good? Explain Signet again. Explain meals again. This is a breeze.
12495 : Great! Well, talking can only prepare you so much. Let's get right down to it. Go ahead and pop one of those %!
12496 : After eating a meal, a status icon designated as Food will appear in the upper-left portion of your screen. Come back and talk to me again once you've confirmed that it's there.
12497 : Check out the full belly on you! Well done! Signet and meals can both play crucial roles whenever you take on any type of enemy. This is a key lesson that you would do well not to forget!
12498 : Next, let's get those pristine hands of yours nice and dirty! No sense in letting that food go to waste now, is there? Let's send you out to fight a monster on a full stomach!
12499 : Exiting through that gate over there will lead you into an area with hostile enemies.
12500 : Try to target one of the monsters and then select the Check option from your menu. This will help you ascertain an enemy's level of difficulty and make sure they are not too strong. A smart adventurer picks [his/her] fights.
12501 : Be warned. Engaging any enemy that checks as very tough or above will result in your Signet not granting you the defense and evasion bonuses you would otherwise receive.
12502 : And that brings us to your next assignment!
12503 : It's high time you learned how to use a weapon skill!
12504 : Perhaps you've already noticed, but sometimes while fighting an enemy, your skills will rise little by little.
12505 : When your skill with the weapon you are wielding reaches a predetermined value, weapon skills will become available for use.
12506 : Combo for those adept with hand-to-hand weapons. Wasp Sting for those who fight with daggers. Fast Blade for those who prefer the sword.
12507 : Shining Strike for wielders of the club. Heavy Swing for those who take up the staff. And on, and on, and on...
12508 : Selecting Status from the main menu will bring up the Combat Skl. option. This will display all of the current skill values in all weapon categories.
12509 : The first weapon skill for each weapon type can be learned at a skill value of 5. So make that your first goal, and we'll take it from there!
12510 : Ohhh! Somebody went and learned a new weapon skill, didn't [he/she]? Very good!
12511 : I can see by that twinkle in your eyes that you've already used it on some poor, unfortunate creature, but I'll explain just a bit more. Whenever your Tactical Points (TP) reach 1000 or more, selecting Abilities and then Weapon Skl. from the menu will display a list of usable weapon skills.
12512 : These are deadly techniques capable of rendering massive damage on enemies. It is well worth an adventurer's time to learn and master them.
12513 : Ah, by the way, were you fortunate enough to receive some items from the monsters you fought?
12514 : If you were lucky enough to come across any %, make sure you hang onto them. They may pay dividends later on...
12515 : Also, that reminds me. There is another lesson better learned sooner than later. The items you will no doubt come across known as crystals, such as % and %, are extremely significant.
12516 : They are truly versatile items that can be used for a number of purposes. These include trading them to guards for certain rewards, and selling them to earn money, just to name a few.
12517 : For now, I'd like to explain more about another of their uses. Namely, the role they play in synthesis.
12518 : But first things first. Your reward for completing your last assignment! Here you are, then. %, %, and last but not least, %.
12519 : Now, using % will bring up the synthesis interface. Once there, select the % and % as the ingredients to be added.
12520 : All that remains is to select the OK option, and the synthesis will commence!
12521 : You'll find that the crafting process will never begin, should the ingredients you've selected not form a viable synthesis recipe. Also, even when your materials are correct, there is always a chance that your synthesis will fail, so please be wary.
12522 : The majority of items which you create via synthesis, as well as most of those dropped by enemies you defeat, can be placed on the Auction House for sale.
12523 : The auction house is an ultra-consumer venue where you can attempt to purchase the wares of other players by placing bids, as well as have other players bid on items you have put up for sale.
12524 : My words alone can do no justice to the vast cornucopia of goods that is the auction house. One simply must see it with one's own eyes.
12525 : Are you still with me? Explain synthesis again. Explain the auction house again. Sure am.
12526 : Somewhere in this great city lies our nation's auction house. Seek it out, and report back to me when you have found it.
12527 : You needn't worry about going through with an actual purchase. Simply examining any of the Auction Counters will more than suffice.
12528 : So, you were able to locate the auction house! Pretty hard to miss, isn't it?
12529 : What do you think? It is as I said, yes? Few organizations in this world exceed the auction house in scale. It will never cease to be of use to you throughout your adventures. It would be wise to become adept at using it.
12530 : And now down to brass tacks! Let's see if we can't get you to up some levels!
12531 : There are several items in existence which serve to enhance the number of experience points you receive for defeating enemies.
12532 : For example, there are %, %, and %, just to name a few.
12533 : These are a bit unique in that you must wait a certain amount of time after equipping them before you may use them.
12534 : There is also a predetermined amount of time, usually quite long, that must pass before these items can be used again. The total number of times you may use any single item is also limited, so be mindful of that as well.
12535 : Many of these items may be obtained from the same guards that provide you with Signet. You need only exchange Conquest Points in order to acquire them.
12536 : As a matter of fact, for finishing that last assignment, I'm going to give you this %. With this, you'll be able to obtain % without having to use any of your Conquest Points.
12537 : Head over to any guard and have a go at exchanging them for something. And after that, see if you can't make it all the way up to level four. I'll be right here waiting for you when you get back.
12538 : With an experience bonus in place, it should take you practically no time at all. Good luck, and be careful! It can get quite hairy out there!
12539 : Well, well, well! We might make an adventurer out of you just yet! Looks like we've almost washed all that green off of you.
12540 : A bit of bad news now, though. Starting from level 31, anytime you are knocked unconscious your experience points will suffer a deduction.
12541 : As a general rule, the amount penalized will be about 10% of the total amount required to reach the next level. You have to be more careful than ever from here on out!
12542 : However, there are ways to minimize this loss of experience points.
12543 : Like this, for example. Go on, take it. Your reward for reaching level four. It's called %.
12544 : Using this will grant you a status known as Reraise. Whenever you are rendered unconscious while this effect is in place, you will have the option to revive yourself.
12545 : Choosing to do so will cause you to be resuscitated in the very spot where you have fallen. In addition, as I stated previously, the amount of experience points you lose will be somewhat lessened.
12546 : % and similar items work in the same manner as the % and the other experience bonus items I mentioned earlier. That is, once equipped, you must wait a certain period of time before they can be used, and there are both cooldown timers and limited charges as well.
12547 : All of these items as a whole are collectively referred to as enchanted items. There is a vast array of other enchanted items with myriad other effects that will prove useful on your adventures. It may be worth the time and effort to better acquaint yourself with them at some point.
12548 : It seems you're starting to get the hang of things. Next, I'd like for you to go and fight some enemies in [La Theine Plateau/the Konschtat Highlands/Tahrongi Canyon].
12549 : [La Theine Plateau/The Konschtat Highlands/Tahrongi Canyon] is located beyond the [southern/northern/northern] reaches of [West Ronfaure/North Gustaberg/East Sarutabaruta].
12550 : You're sure to encounter some new monsters there that you won't find prowling around the outskirts of the city. It may be a bit daunting, so I'll only require that you slay one such beast, and then head on back.
12551 : Just keep in mind, the farther you stray from the city, the more ferocious monsters tend to be. Don't say I didn't warn you.
12552 : Make sure to use the Check command to determine the strength of your enemy. If you find that you are surrounded by enemies too difficult for you, try heading back to a previous area closer to the city and leveling up a bit more first.
12553 : I know those smells... You smell of victory! And of [La Theine Plateau/the Konschtat Highlands/Tahrongi Canyon]! Good on you, %.
12554 : But by now you must be getting sick and tired of fighting the same old monsters so close to the city walls, aren't you?
12555 : If you are several levels beyond a monster and totally outclass them in every respect, checking them will yield a too weak to be worthwhile result.
12556 : Killing monsters so far beneath you is borderline cowardice, and will net you no experience points.
12557 : If you start to notice more and more of these too weak monsters around you, consider moving farther from the city to a more difficult area.
12558 : Congratulations on another milestone! Reward tiiime! You've just earned yourself # experience points, hotshot.
12559 : Let's dive right into your next assignment while that blood is still pumping!
12560 : I'm going to up the stakes here a little bit, %. But it's for your own good. I want you to go out and get all the way to level ten.
12561 : Considering your current level and the knowledge you have, you shouldn't confine yourself to the immediate vicinity of the city. You're more than capable of besting monsters in [La Theine Plateau/the Konschtat Highlands/Tahrongi Canyon] at this point.
12562 : I knew you wouldn't disappoint me. So how's it feel? You're moving on up in the world. Time to put some money in those pockets. A #-gil reward, just for you. Don't spend it all in one place.
12563 : By now you should be relatively familiar with the basics of battle. Am I right or am I right?
12564 : But don't go getting too cocky! This world is chock-full of monsters just waiting for the opportune moment to pounce and knock you out cold!
12565 : Depending on the type of monster, there are several factors that could cause them to attack you without provocation. I'll enumerate some of the more common types of this blatantly aggressive behavior for you.
12566 : For starters, and most obviously, there are monsters which detect by sight. They will attack you whenever you enter their field of vision. This is the most prevalent type. They simply cannot stand the sight of adventurers.
12567 : Next, there are those monsters which detect by sound. They can be a bit more dangerous than visually-dependent monsters, in that they will attack the source of any sound within a certain prescribed radius. You may not think it, but there are a great many monsters whose aural senses are far more developed than their sense of sight.
12568 : There are also monsters which detect their enemies' spellcasting. Much like the sound-detecting types, these monsters will attack the source of any magic casting within a certain radius of their being. Not surprisingly, many monsters in the arcana family rely heavily on this method of detection, which covers a comparatively larger range than the aforementioned sense of hearing.
12569 : And finally, there are opportunistic monsters which prey upon the weak and near-dead, pinpointing their prey by detecting low hit points. The family of undead creatures abound in monsters of this type. Even more distressing, the fewer the hit points you have, the farther the distance from which you can be detected.
12570 : Your next assignment will attempt to familiarize you with these detection methods, and train you to become adept at avoiding them.
12571 : I want you to travel once again to [La Theine Plateau/the Konschtat Highlands/Tahrongi Canyon], and retrieve an item known as a Gate Crystal.
12572 : Near the center of [La Theine Plateau/the Konschtat Highlands/Tahrongi Canyon], you will find a large, white, almost otherworldly structure. On the area map, it is labeled as the [Crag of Holla/Crag of Dem/Crag of Mea].
12573 : There you will find one of an enormous series of crystals known as Telepoints. Simply examine the telepoint you find there, and bring back your findings.
12574 : Only when you present your % to me shall your assignment be complete.
12575 : Exercise the utmost caution. There are many extremely dangerous monsters in the area you will be visiting. And take extra care not to draw the attention of any beastmen.
12576 : This shall be your final assignment. Go now, and may the Goddess watch over you.
12577 : Ahhh, the %, just as I requested. Excellent work, %.
12578 : And now for some information regarding this little beauty. As long as you have this %, you will be able to be transported by the appropriate spell of teleportation directly to the telepoint from which you retrieved it.
12579 : I doubt that you will have many opportunities to use it for the time being, but you would do well to remember what I have said.
12580 : Several such telepoints exist, scattered throughout Vana'diel. Each has its own specific gate crystal, which you will receive the first time that you examine any of them.
12581 : Let me take this time to offer you a most heartfelt congratulations, %! You have successfully completed all of the assignments I have laid before you.
12582 : And here I have a most fitting reward for you. A gift of # experience points, and # %.
12583 : I fear that I have nothing more to teach you. From now on, your lessons will best be learned by giving a mindful ear to others and being ever observant on your travels.
12584 : Do remember, though, that the paths open before you will multiply greatly should you cooperate with other adventurers.
12585 : Leveling, for example, is an endeavor made immeasurably more efficient and enjoyable in the company of others. It helps to not only guarantee you some modicum of safety in numbers, but also rewards you with considerably more experience points than adventuring alone.
12586 : I suppose it does require a good deal of courage to approach an adventurer you do not know, but I strongly encourage you to do so. It may prove to be the beginning of an extremely rewarding and long-lasting friendship.
12587 : There may still be some small facets of adventuring that I can continue to offer you advice on. Should you ever have any questions or anxieties, please do not hesitate to come and see me again. I will do my best to be of service and set your heart at ease.

12589 : Good day to you! Guardian of the Kingdom, Alaune, at your most humble service. Is there something in particular I can help you with this day?
12590 : Good day to you! Defender of the Republic, Gulldago, at your most humble service. Is there something in particular I can help you with this day?
12591 : Good day to you! Protector of the Federation, Selele, at your most humble service.. Is there something in particular I can help you with this day?
12592 : What will you ask about? Nothing just now. Search comments. Skillchains. Magic bursts. Skillchains and elements.
12593 : Just as their name implies, search comments are original messages composed by adventurers which are readily visible to others when using the search function.
12594 : There are several different categories of search comments. These include, but are not limited to, EXP Party, Items, and Missions and Quests.
12595 : Opening the Search function from the Main Menu and then selecting the Comment option will allow you to conduct a player search by comment type.
12596 : For example, if you would like to search for other players to form a leveling party, you need only select EXP Party from the list displayed.
12597 : Conversely, if you would like to advertise yourself as interested in being on the receiving end of an experience party invite, you can choose the Edit Comment command from the Search menu.
12598 : Of course, search comment composition differs from person to person. You might want to conduct a search first to see what type of search comments are considered the norm before writing your own.
12599 : Skillchains are devastating elemental phenomena which manifest themselves when weapon skills are carried out in a precise and well-timed order.
12600 : The very natures of the skillchains themselves differ widely, being dependent upon the weapon skills used and the order of their execution.
12601 : To take a simple and timeless example, using the weapon skill Red Lotus Blade immediately after Fast Blade will yield a type of skillchain known as Liquefaction.
12602 : Furthermore, adding a Combo after the liquefaction effect will produce a more advanced Fusion skillchain.
12603 : In the taxonomy of skillchains, each type is related to one or more specific elements. Liquefaction is bound to the element of fire, for example, and fusion to both fire and light.
12604 : Another crucial point, which I simply cannot emphasize enough, is the importance of timing in the execution of skillchains.
12605 : One must not be too overzealous, but too much patience can also be damning. It is most ideal to time the latter weapon skill to begin just a second or two after the preceding one is complete.
12606 : The possible weapon skill sequences and the different skillchains they yield are highly variegated. It is said of this time-tested battle art that it takes a moment to learn, and a lifetime to master.
12607 : Magic bursts are another type of supernatural phenomena which occur after carefully selected and impeccably timed spells are cast following a skillchain. Such spells exceed their typical counterparts in that they are enhanced in both power and accuracy. You will commonly see magic bursts abbreviated as MB.
12608 : Magic bursts will not take place if the element of the spell being cast does not match the element of the skillchain preceding it.
12609 : To take an example, a detonation skillchain, which has wind as its element, followed by an aero or other like spell, will generate a magic burst.
12610 : In the same vein, thunder, or any cognate spell, would result in a magic burst should it follow an impaction skillchain, itself deriving power from that very element.
12611 : As I said previously, some skillchains are associated with more than one element. Take fragmentation, for example. It is composed of equal parts wind and thunder. So chasing a fragmentation skillchain with any type of aero or thunder spell would create a magic burst.
12612 : The key to mastering magic bursts lies in learning the elemental attributes of both the skillchains you create as well as the magic you wield. The rest is simply a matter of timing.
12613 : For your convenience, I will go over the elemental attributes of all skillchain types. Pay close attention.
12614 : Level 1 Skillchain (Associated element): Transfixion (Light), Liquefaction (Fire), Detonation (Wind), Impaction (Thunder), Induration (Ice), Reverberation (Water), Scission (Earth), Compression (Darkness).
12615 : Level 2 Skillchain (Associated elements): Fusion (Light/Fire), Fragmentation (Wind/Thunder), Distortion (Ice/Water), Gravitation (Earth/Darkness).
12616 : Level 3 Skillchain (Associated elements): Light (Light/Fire/Wind/Thunder), Darkness (Ice/Water/Earth/Darkness).
