12696 : ...But I'm afraid you'll need [/ever so slightly more/a bit more/more/a good deal more/considerably more] experience before you're ready to benefit from my training.
12697 : And yes, it would seem you're at just the right skill level to receive my training. So, what will it be? Which technique would you like to improve?
12698 : Train in which technique? Cancel. Fewell feeding. (Current Lv.: #) Furnace thwacking. (Current Lv.: #) Pressure handle. (Current Lv.: #) Safety lever. (Current Lv.: #) Furnace repair. (Current Lv.: #) Fewell recycling. (Current Lv.: #)

12709 : Research into the composition of the cinder produced as a side effect of synergy just might lead to the next breakthrough in our field. Provide us with samples for analysis, and we will gladly reward your contributions.
12710 : Trade in your cinder? (Currently: # Pz) Not now. %: # Pz. %: # Pz. %: # Pz. %: # Pz. %: # Pz. %: # Pz. %: # Pz. # gil: # Pz.
12711 : This is what you want, correct?

12713 : It would appear that you lack the necessary quantity of cinder for that transaction.
12714 : Excellent! And this is yours. May it serve you well!
12715 : You transferred # Pz of cinder to the synergy engineer. # Pz [remains/remain] in your possession.
12716 : Ask about what? Nothing. Synergy furnaces. Synergy overview. Synergy procedure. Synergy recipes. Fewell replenishment. Materials for sale. Synergy techniques. Trading cinder.
12717 : The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.
12718 : The synergist must provide his or her own %, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process. Provided those conditions are met, synergy furnaces may be used free of charge.
12719 : Needless to say, only one party may operate any given furnace at once.
12720 : Fortunately, there are multiple furnaces installed throughout town. If the furnace before you is already in use, please seek out an unused one elsewhere, or wait patiently for your turn.
12721 : You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis. It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.
12722 : Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results. The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.
12723 : This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call fewell. To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!
12724 : As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require. Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.
12725 : With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing! Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. Approach the prescribed elemental balance, and your item will take form, allowing you to remove it from the furnace.
12726 : The closer you are to the ideal elemental balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be. In synergy, it pays to be a perfectionist!
12727 : But be forewarned: these furnaces can only sustain the elemental maelstrom swirling and storming inside them for so long.
12728 : If the furnace's durability should fail, the synergy process will be interrupted, and you will be forced to start anew.
12729 : Take heart, though, as any materials inside your % will remain intact. You may retrieve them or attempt the synergy process again as you see fit.
12730 : Any fewell consumed in the failed synergy attempt, on the other hand, will be permanently lost.
12731 : Synergists must also be wary of debris buildup, an unavoidable side effect of the volatile elemental reactions that take place within the synergy furnace.
12732 : Should too much debris be allowed to accumulate, the contents of the furnace will become unstable, potentially leading to unpleasant explosions and eruptions. Such accidents pose considerable risk to the synergy attempt in progress, as well as the physical well-being of the synergist, so be sure to exercise due caution!
12733 : You may be asking yourself, Why, how in the name of Hildolf am I going to oversee all of these complicated procedures and variables by myself?
12734 : Here's the good news: you don't have to! For you see, synergy furnaces are designed for use by multiple operators.
12735 : The more complex the recipe, the greater level of skill and hands-on manipulation it will demand. At such times, it would be in your best interest to seek out like-minded synergists and take on the challenge together.
12736 : Finally, it would be remiss of me not to make mention of %, the curious substance whose properties are only now--with the emergence of synergy--becoming known to us.
12737 : Though there is much yet to be learned, our research has revealed that % may be used to bolster your equipment, if attached in a proper manner.
12738 : Mind you, % is not easy to come by, and I can offer no clues as to where or how to obtain it. Should you be fortunate enough to come across some in your travels, however, I encourage you to explore its potential.
12739 : Synergy is not a discipline for the faint of heart or mind, but with dedication and cooperation, there are great rewards to be reaped. May your career as a synergist prove fruitful!
12740 : First, you'll be wanting to check your fewell supply. You may do so by speaking with a synergy engineer such as myself, or by examining a synergy furnace.
12741 : You'll be needing at least one unit of fewell for each element dictated by your recipe. Without this, even the most skilled synergist cannot hope to succeed.
12742 : Should your fewell supply be in order, it's time to proceed with the synergy. If you are using one of these public synergy furnaces here, you'll need to examine it and lay claim to its use.
12743 : You may then deposit your ingredients. Should they correspond to a proper recipe, the synergy furnace will fire up automatically. Note that as a safety precaution, the furnace will not activate if the recipe is beyond your level of synergy skill.
12744 : From here, it becomes a race against the clock! Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.
12745 : Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task. First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.
12746 : Next, you can begin to feed fewell into the furnace to gradually raise the level of elemental concentration. Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.
12747 : However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions. Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.
12748 : If you sense that the furnace is on the verge of elemental overload, you'll want to employ the safety lever and pressure handle to prevent an unfortunate accident from occurring.
12749 : You'll also want to mind the laws of elemental ascendancy and opposition. Increasing the concentration of a particular element will cause its counterpart to decrease.
12750 : The furnace cannot sustain its power indefinitely, and will gradually lose durability as the synergy process continues. You'll need to perform periodic furnace repair should the furnace near its breaking point.
12751 : It is also possible to recycle strewn fewell during synergy. While this will not impact the success or failure of the process itself, it will result in a greater amount of salvageable cinder produced as a by-product.
12752 : This cinder is of great interest to our researchers back at the institute. As such, we have introduced a reward system through which quality samples can be traded in for an assortment of synergy-related wares.
12753 : As marvelous an apparatus as the synergy furnace may be, keep in mind that the technology is still in its infancy, and highly unstable. There may be times when accidents occur despite the best efforts of the synergist.
12754 : For your safety, we recommend stepping as far away from the furnace as possible at the first sign of danger. Some synergists claim that giving the furnace a good thwack is also effective in preventing such accidents, but this is pure madness, if you ask me!
12755 : You will also find that there are numerous techniques that can be applied to make the synergy procedure go even more smoothly.
12756 : In many cases, expertise and knowledge acquired through crafting will serve you in synergy as well. To truly master synergy, one must master crafting as well.
12757 : Now let us return to the synergy process itself. As your elemental balance approaches that prescribed by the recipe, the furnace will signal you, and you may retrieve your finished product.
12758 : If the furnace is still holding strong at this time, you may choose to keep working to achieve an even closer balance. The closer you come to the ideal balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.
12759 : Indeed, many synergy masters consider these waning moments after the signal to be the time to really show off their skills! Why, if they manage to achieve an elemental surge...
12760 : What's an elemental surge, you ask? Why, it's a miraculous phenomenon that occurs rarely--ever so rarely--upon feeding the furnace fewell.
12761 : The elements react just in the right way, creating a miraculous reaction that brings the level of elemental concentration to exactly the desired level. Truly a boon from the Goddess for any synergist, no?
12762 : ...And that is the synergy process in a nutshell. There's quite a bit of information to take in, so don't hesitate to return any time for a refresher course.
12763 : Much like synthesis, to fashion items through synergy, you will need to follow a recipe. We synergy engineers are always unearthing new recipes, and are happy to share with you those suitable for your level of skill.
12764 : Unlike synthesis, however, a synergy recipe is more than just a list of ingredients. There is also a required elemental balance that must be attained to achieve your desired result.
12765 : Simple recipes involve only small doses of a limited number of elements, but more complex ones require the synergist to skillfully juggle wide ranges of elements in extremely high concentrations.
12766 : The ingredients, you will have to remember on your own. The required elemental balance, however, may be reviewed at any time during the synergy process by observing the readings on the synergy furnace.
12767 : In particular, recipes through which the curious substance known as % can be attached to equipment are creating quite a buzz among synergistically inclined adventurers these days.
12768 : % cannot be attached directly. First, equipment must be prepared by etching an aperture into which an elementally compatible piece of % can then be embedded.
12769 : The type of aperture that may be etched will depend on the piece of equipment. There are also pieces of equipment that, alas, may not be modified at all.
12770 : If you are curious what manner of aperture may be etched into a particular piece of equipment, you need only trade it to me or one of my colleagues.
12771 : As a general rule, the higher the level of the item in question, the more difficult the synergy process for creating an aperture will be.
12772 : You will find that certain pieces of equipment may be etched with multiple apertures. It is, however, only possible to create one aperture at a time.
12773 : Etching requires the use of a corrosive substance we call mordant. Deposit mordant into a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and the process will begin.
12774 : My colleagues and I have a stock of mordant available for sale. The best way to learn is to practice, so if you're curious, we encourage you to purchase some and begin experimenting!
12775 : The difficulty of the synergy process when embedding evolith is decided by a number of factors.
12776 : Such factors include the variety of aperture and evolith, as well as the quantity of evolith you seek to attach. Embedding the first piece is not too difficult a task, but the second and third pieces will not go in so easily.
12777 : To begin the embedding process, deposit your evolith into the synergy furnace along with a piece of equipment with a compatible aperture.
12778 : When etching or embedding, the required elemental balance may be confirmed at any time during the synergy process, so let this be your guide.
12779 : Should you ever wish to remove any apertures and embedded evolith from a piece of equipment entirely, you may do so with an ingredient we call revertant.
12780 : Toss the revertant in a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and its potent powers will restore your item to a pure and pristine state! Be warned, however, that embedded evolith will be lost forever in the process.
12781 : As you are no doubt already aware, synergy makes use of a highly combustible form of elemental crystals that we call fewell. The more complex the recipe, the greater the quantity of fewell required.
12782 : Veteran synergists know well the hassle of having to constantly monitor their fewell supply and procure crystals to replenish depleted stock.
12783 : To free you of such trifling burdens and allow you to focus your mind entirely on your art, we synergy engineers are offering a convenient fewell replenishment service!
12784 : For a nominal fee calculated based upon the current state of your fewell reserves, we will instantly refill you to full capacity.
12785 : That's right--all elements in one simple transaction, directly to your %! What could be easier?
12786 : Looking to fire up your furnace and enter the world of %? If so, you've come to the right place!
12787 : We're proud to offer a supply of the corrosive agent known as mordant for sale. With this, synergy newcomers can hone their skills and outfit their equipment with evolith-capable apertures in the process.
12788 : Mind you, our stock is limited to only the most diluted, readily produced form of the stuff. You'll find that it only has the strength to etch items of relatively low level.
12789 : Etching high-powered equipment requires the use of more concentrated and potent forms of mordant. As quantities are limited, we can offer these only in exchange for cinder.
12790 : Ah, synergy techniques! Those handy tricks of the trade that can mean the difference between a shiny new item and a major furnace meltdown.
12791 : My colleagues and I are always eager to train fellow synergists in a wide range of techniques. We can't do it all, though--you'll need to hone your synergy skill in order to benefit from our instruction.
12792 : Bear in mind that certain techniques can only be imparted to students possessing specialized crafting knowledge. For example, only skilled smiths will be able to comprehend the method for more efficient fewell feeding.
12793 : Accomplished goldsmiths will be able to observe the inner workings of the furnace and stave off potential accidents. You will find that all crafting skills--even those you may not expect--may be applied in some way to support the synergy process.
12794 : Word has it that there are also pieces of equipment that can impart hidden synergy techniques to the wearer. These, too, are said to be only accessible to skilled crafters.
12795 : The moral of the story is this: while synergy skill is important, neglect not your other crafting skills. To become a true synergy master, finding the proper balance is key.
12796 : Synergy remains a young discipline, and researchers back at the institute are burning the midnight fewell in the hopes of uncovering the next breakthrough in our field.
12797 : Research of late is centered around the cinder that is left behind as a by-product of each synergy operation. Their composition, it would seem, has much to teach us of the true nature of the complex elemental reactions that go on within the bellies of these furnaces.
12798 : We've even instituted a reward program for adventurers willing to contribute prime samples in the name of science.
12799 : It would be no exaggeration to say that, to us, cinder is worth more than its weight in gold! Bring it to me or my colleagues--preferably in large quantities--and you're sure to be pleased at what we can offer you in return.

12940 : Atmacite is best described as the crystalline agglomeration of a creature's soul. Our scientists have succeeded in discovering a way to tap its power to serve the efforts of the Voidwatch.
12941 : By infusing one's body with atmacite, it is possible to obtain powers akin to those once possessed by the creature whence it came, rather like turning a beast's fangs upon its own kind.
12942 : At first glance, atmacite appears to be the perfect artificial enhancement. However, it does suffer from a single limitation: its power is unleashed only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.
12943 : Research to identify the exact reason for this continues, but most scientists find the spectral alignment theory compelling.
12944 : That is, being formed of Voidwalker souls, atmacite will surge to life only when its bearer is existentially aligned to its dimension of origin.
12945 : From this it can be inferred that Voidwalkers are stripped of considerable strength when they cross over into Vana'diel.
12946 : But I suspect this is of little interest to a layman like you. Allow me to return to the subject at hand.
12947 : The infusion of atmacite requires cruor, a potent energy source that takes the form of shiny red granules.
12948 : Cruor is obtainable by various means, felling a Voidwalker being the most common of all. As you can never have too much cruor, I urge you to be diligent in its procurement.
12949 : We've recently perfected a method for improving atmacite potency. The process is called enrichment, and involves fusing cruor on to atmacite to amplify its power.
12950 : Atmacite can be enriched in stages up to a maximum of level #. The quantity of cruor required varies with the variety of atmacite as well as its current enrichment level.
12951 : Under normal conditions, atmacite enrichment is an intensive process that demands trained hands. For reasons yet to be determined, however, both infusion and enrichment can be safely performed by laymen, provided they're at a planar rift.
12952 : Keep this in mind should the need arise to reconfigure your atmacite with haste.

13751 : A bewitching light shines forth from within the crystallized walls of this fragment ripped from a Voidwalker, as if beckoning its bearer to come hither.

13754 : What will you ask about? Nothing. The Voidwalker threat. How I can do my part. The Voidwatch. Voidwatchers. Ascent items. Riftworn pyxides. %. Stratum abyssite. Planar rifts. Cruor. Abyssite. Voidstone consumption.
13755 : Voidwalker is the name given to creatures that roam the realm between worlds.
13756 : Little is known about them at this time, except that they're driven by an insatiable lust for destruction.
13757 : While reports of Voidwalker encounters vary greatly in content, one thing is certain: the creatures are gaining in strength, a mounting threat that cannot be left unchecked.
13758 : In our effort to neutralize the Voidwalker menace, the Voidwatch is petitioning adventurers to lend their aid.
13759 : As the nature of Voidwalker battles renders full-scale military operations unfeasible, we have chosen to stake our success on the mobility and versatility of adventurers.
13760 : In our effort to neutralize the Voidwalker menace, the Voidwatch is petitioning soldiers of the Allied Forces to lend their aid.
13761 : To be sure, there're those who question the wisdom of thinning our ranks in the face of the Shadow Lord's armies. But I assure you, friend, the Voidwalker threat is no less real.
13762 : Our scouts regularly bring back intel on locations of suspected Voidwalker presence.
13763 : Armed with this information, we dispatch strike teams to preemptively neutralize the threat.
13764 : Ordinarily, Voidwalkers cannot be seen, let alone fought. Only by using the voidstone's power can we force them to feel the sting of our steel.
13765 : These magicked stones are distributed in regular shipments from our Jeuno-based research team. They're the bare minimum we need to have a fighting chance against the enemy.
13766 : Voidstones work by realigning your existential spectrum to match that of Voidwalkers, thus rendering the creatures visible to you.
13767 : The stones are highly prized, such is the difficulty of their creation. As such, supplies are limited to # stones per person at any given time.
13768 : That's provided we have any in stock at all. Much time is required in imbuing them with requisite powers.
13769 : The Voidwatch is an organization that exists for the sole purpose of protecting the world from extradimensional invaders we call Voidwalkers.
13770 : Recognizing the graveness of this threat, the nations of the Middle Lands joined together in common cause and formed the Voidwatch.
13771 : Helming the organization is the Grand Duchy of Jeuno, with the remaining three nations contributing resources for its operation.
13772 : Possession of % is a requirement for participating in Voidwatch Ops.
13773 : It can be earned only through loyal service to your nation, and thus serves as a testimonial for your prowess.
13774 : You would do well to obtain one if you haven't already done so.
13775 : Affiliation with the Allied Forces of Altana is a requirement for participating in Voidwatch Ops.
13776 : In other words, you must belong to the armed forces of one of the three nations.
13777 : The enlistment procedure varies depending on nation. Those wishing to obtain a recommendation letter should pay visit to one of the military encampments surrounding Jeuno.
13778 : When you battle a Voidwalker, you must do so as a Voidwatcher--a defender of the dimension who has harnessed the powers of the voidstone and stratum abyssite.
13779 : Bereft of these two objects, Voidwalkers cannot be seen, let alone fought.
13780 : However, there are a few points all budding Voidwatchers should bear in mind.
13781 : Most crucial of all, the extradimensional nature of being a Voidwatcher renders you isolated and unable to receive help from the outside world.
13782 : Scientists attribute this to the dimensional misalignment that occurs. As people are ordinarily unable to see Voidwalkers, so too are they unable to see you.
13783 : But you needn't concern yourself with the hows and whys of such matters. It would behoove you far more to become familiar with the workings of the existential spectrum.
13784 : You see, each dimension is composed of an existential spectrum to which all things within are aligned. In turn, the spectrum is formed of five lights: blue, red, yellow, green, and white.
13785 : The alignment of these lights between Voidwalker and Voidwatcher plays an important role in our efforts.
13786 : To elaborate, the act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning ourselves to its existential spectrum.
13787 : Now, while Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with these creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.
13788 : Compensating measures, however, have been developed to allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe.
13789 : One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as ascent items, while another entails performing certain actions against the enemy.
13790 : Both methods aim to manipulate the alignment value of individual lights to various ends.
13791 : All five lights influence the contents of the treasure chest which appears at the successful end of battle.
13792 : Our researchers have succeeded in determining what manner of benefits are associated with each light.
13793 : For instance, improving blue spectral alignment is known to produce greater quantities of spoils.
13794 : In contrast, manipulating red spectral alignment reportedly enhances the quality of individual items--potions becoming hi-potions, and so forth.
13795 : Yellow and green, on the other hand, influence experience gain and cruor yield respectively.
13796 : If you wish to know more about the curious red substance we call cruor, you need but ask.
13797 : Lastly, we have white spectral alignment, which is unique even in this company. It has been determined to affect the appearance of transdimensional objects such as atmacite and periapt.
13798 : Research regarding these artifacts is still ongoing.
13799 : Lastly, be reassured that there're no known negative effects of manipulating spectral alignment. We unreservedly encourage all Voidwatch operatives to endeavor towards maximum alignment.
13800 : Ascent items are unique objects that can be used to manipulate the spectral alignment of corresponding lights in the existential spectrum.
13801 : % and % are representative of such items. They're the pride and joy of our Jeuno-based research team, who'd have folk believe they're the greatest inventions since airships.
13802 : (Just between you and me, though, it is Far Eastern scientists that pioneered the technology they're based upon.)
13803 : They're not the only means by which we manipulate spectral alignment, mind you. Similar results can be achieved by performing specific actions against the enemy.
13804 : Truth be told, much is still shrouded in mystery. What actions will produce the desired effect is something you will have to discover for yourself through trial and error.
13805 : Defeating a Voidwalker will cause a mysterious pyxis to emerge at the selfsame planar rift whence the creature was felled.
13806 : Such riftworn pyxides exhibit a most peculiar characteristic: the content they bear reportedly changes depending on who glimpses within.
13807 : Our scientists conjecture that this is due to some trick of spectral alignment. As with numerous other mysteries surrounding Voidwalkers, however, I highly doubt they have even an inkling of understanding. But I digress...
13808 : Only one combatant need possess a voidstone for all party or alliance members to do battle with a Voidwalker. Of the other squad members only stratum abyssite is required.
13809 : As always seems to be the case, however, there is a catch. Pyxides have been observed to yield less spoils for combatants without a voidstone of their own.
13810 : It scarce needs be said, but it would be to your benefit to have both the aforementioned items readied before taking on a Voidwalker.
13811 : Lastly, a warning: pyxides will eventually vanish if left untouched overlong. Our scientists have put forth the theory of normalizing spatial dissonance, but you needn't concern yourself with their mumbo-jumbo.
13812 : Just see to it that your hard-earned spoils are claimed in good time, and things will be rosy for all involved.
13813 : The % is a magicked object produced by the Voidwatch's Jeuno-based research wing.
13814 : Its innocuous appearance belies the immense power it holds...the power to render Voidwalkers visible to its bearer.
13815 : The stone achieves this feat by realigning our existential spectrum to that of the creature.
13816 : I shall explain the process in layman's terms for your benefit. No need to thank me--I merely perform my duty.
13817 : I want you to visualize two canvases, each the same distance from the other. Yes, as two separate objects are normally wont to be.
13818 : Imagine you and I standing on one of the canvases--what else does one do with a canvas but stand on it, yes?
13819 : Now, imagine Voidwalkers standing on the other canvas, doing whatever it is Voidwalkers do. Destroying things and behaving with utter impropriety, no doubt.
13820 : Being on two different canvases, it follows that we cannot touch the Voidwalkers, let alone see them. Actually, that doesn't explain why we can't see the Voidwalkers...unless it's a magical canvas they're on that makes all things upon it invisible! Yes, that'll serve!
13821 : And this brings us full circle back to the voidstone. I want you to think of it as a magical paintbrush that we use to...grapple ourselves over to the Voidwalkers' canvas. Thence the fighting begins.
13822 : I trust you now have a rudimentary understanding of the process. That's all you need, really. Leave the fractal geometry to the fractal geometrists, I always say.
13823 : As long as you remember the canvas and the paintbrush--that's the voidstone--you cannot go astray. Now, to apprise you of more practical matters...
13824 : Twenty hours (Earth time) is required to produce a stone and imbue it with the necessary magicks, although word is that this may be shortened as research progresses.
13825 : Mind you, this isn't the only variety of stone you'll be needing. There exists another: stratum abyssite.
13826 : Whereas the voidstone serves as a power source, acting as a compass for channeling that power is stratum abyssite. Only by using the two in conjunction can we achieve our objectives.
13827 : Are you familiar with voiddust? Put simply, it is a granular substance from which voidstones may be fabricated.
13828 : As I explained, significant time is required to produce a voidstone from scratch. Provide me with voiddust, however, and I can fashion a stone for you in short order.
13829 : The same comrades of ours who stock ascent items may also furnish you with voiddust. Why do they not fabricate the stones themselves, or deliver the dust directly to me? Shush! The Voidwatch works in mysterious ways, and it would behoove you to inquire no further.
13830 : At any rate, should you manage to obtain any voiddust in your travels, you need only return here and trade it to me. Simple enough, wouldn't you say?
13831 : Furthermore, this particular variety of abyssite is known to absorb the energy released by felled Voidwalkers. Not any of the creatures, mind you, but only those drawn to planar rifts.
13832 : Based on the evolutionary state of your stratum abyssite, the Voidwatch will direct you to a suitable operation area.
13833 : If you wish to have your stone analyzed, simply present it to an atma refiner.
13834 : Planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space--have manifested across the land. The Voidwalker hordes roam beyond, unchecked and ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.
13835 : By invoking the power of stratum abyssite, it is possible to battle the fell creatures as a Voidwatcher--a defender of our dimension.
13836 : Those also possessed of a voidstone will find their Voidwatcher experience greatly enhanced.
13837 : Alone, however, stratum abyssite serves no purpose; only when used in conjunction with a voidstone can its powers be unleashed.
13838 : Hence, at least one member of your squad--be it party or alliance--must possess a voidstone in order to arrange a confrontation with a Voidwalker.
13839 : Keep this fact in mind at all times.
13840 : It is not known when the planar rifts first manifested. Some say they've always been there, while others claim recent events have triggered their appearance.
13841 : If only we could return to the past, perhaps we could shed some light upon this mystery...
13842 : Obtainable by defeating Voidwalkers, cruor is an energy source that takes the form of shiny red granules.
13843 : While appearing to be some manner of mineral, detailed analysis has revealed that cruor is in fact organic.
13844 : As far as our researchers can tell, however, it's inanimate like most well-behaved plants. There's no fear of cruor suddenly springing to life in your palms.
13845 : Being supremely pleasing to the eyes, cruor might have adorned the display cases of many a jewelry shop during peacetime. Unfortunately, the age demands that its unique properties be put to more practical uses.
13846 : Namely, the infusion and enrichment of atmacite. If you wish to learn about these two processes, you need but ask an atmacite refiner, our experts on such matters.
13847 : As cruor is a vital aspect of our operations, the Voidwatch is always looking to procure more. Should you have any excess cruor, we would be glad to take it off your hands and offer you useful items in exchange.
13848 : Abyssite is the name given to a mysterious stone that assumes various forms and colors, the roles they serve likewise manifold in nature.
13849 : Of the copious varieties thus far discovered, there exist those called periapt--lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.
13850 : Defeating a Voidwalker is known to yield periapt on very rare occasions. Serve the Voidwatch earnestly, however, and you will surely have one to call your own.

14576 : Unity Concord is a system promulgated and managed by the Adventurers' Mutual Aid Network.
14577 : Participating adventurers are able to receive a variety of benefits and rewards just by engaging in their everyday activities.
14578 : Unity is a catchall term that refers to the group that participants belong to.
14579 : Unity leaders are individuals who have strong ties to adventurers' activities and are sterling representatives of their home nations.
14580 : Members of the same Unity can converse with each other over great distances through the use of specialized figurines known as %.
14581 : Chat settings may be changed by selecting Status from the main menu, and choosing Unity Info under the Unity submenu.
14582 : You may not always be able to join the chat if too many players are participating at once.
14583 : Those belonging to a Unity are able to undertake special Records of Eminence objectives related to Unity Concord activities.
14584 : The three pertinent categories include shared objectives, Unity leader-specific objectives, and Wanted battle objectives.
14585 : Shared objectives may be taken regardless of which Unity you have joined. These tasks can be undertaken at any time, and change every day at midnight (JST).
14586 : Unity leader-specific objectives are tied to the Unity's eponymous leader and change each week.
14587 : Wanted objectives center around vanquishing particularly heinous foes that terrorize Vana'diel.
14588 : These objectives are of a higher caliber, and thus require currency known as Unity accolades to undertake.
14589 : Shared and leader-specific objectives provide more accolades than run-of-the-mill objectives.
14590 : Vana'diel has always been plagued by nefarious foes pillaging the landscape, but relatives of some of the more heinous ones have been spotted lately.
14591 : The A.M.A.N. has deemed it necessary to eliminate these Wanted targets, and has notified Unity members that they are of the utmost priority.
14592 : A list of these foes can be viewed at any time by selecting the appropriate subcategory under the objectives list.
14593 : Unity Concord representatives are able to provide participants with transportation to the areas where these threats can be found.
14594 : Though tackling the profane will likely require participation of your allies, the objective can be undertaken so long as at least one person has set the appropriate objective.
14595 : When you set the objective and commence the battle, the requisite number of Unity accolades will be deducted from your total.
14596 : Successful challengers will be rewarded with special rewards in addition to the normal sparks of eminence.
14597 : No Unity accolades will be charged should you commence the battle without having the appropriate objective set, but the rewards you can reap from your efforts will be limited.
14598 : You can snatch unparalleled equipment and materials from the slain corpses of Wanted targets.
14599 : An A.M.A.N. specialist versed in arcane harmonization has kindly offered to use these materials to bring out the latent potential in such pieces.
14600 : One of the Unity guides will be pleased to accept certain combinations of equipment and materials to begin the process for you.
14601 : A number of accolades is required for this service, but the precision and accuracy of her methods are without equal, and there is no worry of your equipment being destroyed.
14602 : You can use specified materials to add new attributes to equipment that has been upgraded.
14603 : Utilizing additional materials after adding an attribute can accumulate Reinforcement Points for the equipment and increase its rank.
14604 : Increasing your equipment's rank can boost its attributes, while some equipment can also have additional attributes added later.
14605 : Speak to the Unity guides after gathering the necessary materials for your equipment in order to add attributes to it or increase its rank.
14606 : The first time you add an attribute to a piece of equipment will require the use of Unity accolades.
14607 : It also requires that you first complete a specific Records of Eminence objective.
14608 : The work you request will be carried out on-site by a specially trained Unity guide.
14609 : Completing Records of Eminence objectives as part of a Unity will reward you with Unity accolades in addition to sparks of eminence.
14610 : These accolades not only serve as a symbol of prestige, but can also be exchanged for a variety of services.
14611 : Some of these services include purchasing items, securing battle zones for hunting Wanted targets, fees for strengthening equipment, and more.
14612 : Please note that you may only exchange a maximum of # accolades per week (Earth time).
14613 : You may switch Unities once during the Unity ranking tabulation period.
14614 : This is not a decision to be taken lightly, for switching Unities will cause you to forfeit any benefits you were receiving from your previous one.
14615 : This process requires a fair deal of paperwork, and the A.M.A.N. will charge you an accolade fee based on your rank.
14616 : However, your valorous deeds remain wherever you choose to go, and you will not lose any other accolades.
14617 : Rankings are decided through the combined efforts of each of the Unity's members.
14618 : The A.M.A.N. tabulates all the good deeds done during a period of time and confers benefits on a Unity for the following ranking period.
14619 : Some of these benefits include changes to Unity accolades gained and the effects of equipment earned from Wanted battles.
14620 : Yes, you read that correctly--the attributes of certain equipment will increase in line with your Unity's ranking.
14621 : On the other hand, members of a Unity that finds itself on the lower rungs will enjoy an increase in accolades and capacity points earned to help bring them up to par.
14622 : Additionally, an individual's evaluation is the sum of the accolades they have earned divided by #. A Unity's ranking is the average of all eligible members' individual evaluations.
14623 : The A.M.A.N. does not look kindly on those who only seek to siphon rewards from others' hard work, and thus only confers these boons on those who have collected at least a certain number of accolades.
14624 : Unity leaders may also join you as alter egos for a limited period of time.
14625 : Those with evaluations of # or greater will be able to call forth an alter ego of their leader to assist them in battle.
14626 : Those eligible will be able to use the alter ego from the moment they acquire the appropriate ranking level until the tabulation after the next.
14627 : A leader's alter ego grows in power the higher their Unity is ranked.
14628 : Changing Unities will remove the player's ability to call forth their leader's alter ego at the moment they leave their current Unity, regardless of personal evaluation or remaining time.
14629 : A player will have to work hard in their new Unity and acquire a sufficient evaluation to regain the ability to call forth their new Unity's leader.
14630 : It goes without saying that players must first have acquired a Trust permit in order to avail themselves of this opportunity.
14631 : Those desiring to participate should seek out one of the initiative's representatives, dressed in green, in one of the three nations.

15098 : I hope you ready to play new game, 'Mandragora Mania Madness'!
15099 : Since this new game, would you like to check rules in manual?
15100 : Read the manual? Sure. No thanks.
15101 : Mandragora Mania Madness is a game in which players battle by placing different colored game pieces on a 4x4 playing area.
15102 : You use the white pieces (mandragoras), while your opponent uses the black pieces (corrigans).
15103 : The player to go first is determined randomly when the game begins. You will be able to adjust these settings yourself from the second game onward.
15104 : The first player to place four pieces so they align in a row will be declared the winner.
15105 : However, you will automatically be disqualified if you ever place three of your pieces in a row, so be mindful of your moves at all times.
15106 : Note that if you place your game pieces so that you have both three and four pieces in a row, the row with four pieces will take precedence and you will win the game.
15107 : If you place a game piece on either side of your opponent's piece, you will convert it into one of your pieces.
15108 : You can play anywhere from three to five games, and the first player to win three games is the winner.
15109 : Now, for an explanation on points.
15110 : You receive points after the completion of each game. The points are tallied using units known as mandy.
15111 : If you win the game, you will receive a number of points equal to the number of game pieces you have on the board. In the example shown, you will earn 8 mandy.
15112 : Even if you lose the game, you will receive a number of points equal to half the number of your game pieces on the board (rounded off to avoid fractions).
15113 : The first player to win three games gets to keep all of the points they have earned, although you won't get any points if you quit partway.
15114 : Occasionally, you might get to play a bonus game, where your pieces are pink (adenium) or feature a watermelon pattern (citrullus).
15115 : They are worth #x and #x the points, respectively, giving you the chance to quickly score a large number of points.
15116 : The key to victory is to not just try and place four pieces in a row, but to position your pieces in a way that forces your opponent to place three pieces in a row.
15117 : See? Is very easy! Ready to give try?

15169 : You see, I've convinced all the movers and shakers in Bastok to assist me in holding the most amazing fashion show the city--no, all of Vana'diel!--has ever seen!
15170 : The city is hoping that this initiative will help stimulate the local economy, bringing in people from far and wide to spend, spend, spend!
15171 : You see, fashion does not discriminate between creed or place of origin--and I firmly believe that there is an outfit for everyone.
15172 : But I'm having trouble finding people to lend themselves to the cause.
15173 : If I didn't know better, I'd think people were mistaking my honest critiques for cruel barbs hurled by an uncaring judge.
15174 : Yet fashion can at times be uncompromising, and that's where you come in.
15175 : Assist me, and I promise that I'll come up with the perfect disguise for your friend Raebrimm.
15176 : After all, if I can't help you, then who can?

15183 : The First Annual Brygid Cosplay Fiesta!!!
15184 : Let me know if you want to hear more.
15185 : But here's what I want you to do in the short term: decide on someone after whom you want to model your costume.
15186 : This is going to be the best fashion show ever!
15187 : This costume show is going to be the talk of the town for months, and here's how it's going to work.
15188 : If you listen to my explanation well and decide on someone spectacular to dress as, there's no way anything'll go wrong!
15189 : Any questions? What's this costume show about? Who can I dress as? I've decided! Nothing for now.
15190 : In this costume show, you select a person whose appearance you want to mimic and dress up just like them.
15191 : Since the show takes place in Bastok, it only makes sense for you to pick one of the city's many storied personages.
15192 : Once you've picked a mark...I mean, a person...you need to look very carefully at what they're wearing and try to come up with an identical outfit.
15193 : Specifically, take a look at their headgear, chestgear, handgear, leggear, and footwear. You don't have to worry about their weapons or accessories.
15194 : Once you've got your garb nice and squared away, put it on and head to the Steaming Sheep restaurant.
15195 : That's where my special runway awaits, needing only for you to stand atop it and strike a dashing pose.
15196 : Of course, I know this is a decent amount of work, and although fashion is a reward unto itself, I've still prepared monetary compensation for all participants. The more you impress the crowd, the better the reward.
15197 : So try to come up with the perfect outfit and whip the audience into a frenzy!
15198 : The first thing you have to know is that the wonderful Brygid believes that good sense transcends all races and genders, so what's important is the costume itself; if a Tarutaru male wants to mimic a Mithra, that's A-OK in my book.
15199 : However, this particular show really focuses on particular famous people from here in the city, so I want you to mimic certain individuals. No choosing some random hick from over in Rabao.
15200 : It's only common sense. Where's the fun in dressing up as someone that nobody's ever heard of?
15201 : ...And it pains me to say this, but some of the best choices have already been taken by other participants.
15202 : So let's go down the list of potential selections. First up is Azima, the esteemed master of alchemy.
15203 : Next is Naji, the famed Mythril Musketeer.
15204 : Also available is Black Mud, a salesperson most popular.
15205 : Another option is Michea, an Elvaan goldsmith with a work ethic of gold.
15206 : Finally, we've got Nbu Latteh, whose fashion sense is second to none.
15207 : And that's our cast of characters for the show! Let me know once you've made your selection.
15208 : Have you made up your mind? Remember that this is really important, so choose wisely.
15209 : Who will you dress as? Azima. Naji. Black Mud. Michea. Nbu Latteh. I need more time.
15210 : Are you sure that [Azima/Naji/Black Mud/Michea/Nbu Latteh] is the choice for you?
15211 : Are you sure? Yup! Hold on...
15212 : All right! I've made a mental note of your selection. Remember that accuracy is key, so study up on [Azima/Naji/Black Mud/Michea/Nbu Latteh]'s attire and mimic it as best you can.
15213 : Unless, of course, you're content with being called a two-bit hack the rest of your life, in which case you can dress like a mad scientist for all I care.
15214 : Once you think you've got the outfit as good as you're going to get it, head to the Steaming Sheep in Port Bastok.
15215 : The show takes place at the Steaming Sheep.
15216 : ...Or is there something you'd like to discuss?
15217 : Any questions? How can I get first place? I'd like to switch targets. None.
15218 : Ah, how exciting it is to see someone who recognizes that fashion is a battlefield and wants to emerge the victor! Listen carefully, because this is pretty important.
15219 : The first thing you need to do is pay really, really close attention to what your target is wearing.
15220 : Points are awarded on a per-item basis, and I shouldn't have to tell you that you'll actually have to wear the outfit--simply having it stored in your bags isn't enough.
15221 : Specifically, points are awarded for headgear, chestgear, handgear, leggear, and footwear. You don't have to worry about their weapons or accessories.
15222 : If you don't match what they're wearing in a particular location, you won't score any points for that location.
15223 : It all sounds so simple, but finding the perfect outfit is more of an art than a science. Once you've got your outfit all set, head to the Steaming Sheep and sashay your way to victory!

15253 : This is an explanation of the Assist Channel feature, which allows new and returning players to seek help from veteran adventurers.
15254 : You must take on the % Records of Eminence objective before receiving the explanation.
15255 : You must complete % before taking on the % Records of Eminence objective.
15256 : What do you want to learn about? What is the Assist Channel? How can I post a message? What are the requirements? Where can I access it? Tell me about mentor messages. Where can I find mentors? What are Thumbs Up and Warnings? What happens if I am muted? When do my posting rights expire? Nothing for now.
15257 : The Assist Channel is a special chat channel that allows adventurers to ask questions and receive advice from veteran players known as mentors.
15258 : Press the space bar to bring up the text window at the bottom of the screen and type /assistj (your message) or /assiste (your message) to post your message.
15259 : You can also use /aj for /assistj, and /ae for /assiste.
15260 : Additionally, pressing CTRL+Q will display /assistj or /assiste in the text window for you.
15261 : You can change the CTRL+Q shortcut command...
15262 : ...by going to Main Menu > Config > Misc. 2 > Key Assignment > Commands > Chat: /AssistE or /AssistJ.
15263 : It is recommended that you use /assistj (/aj) when posting in Japanese, and /assiste (/ae) when posting in English.
15264 : You must meet one of the following conditions in order to post to the Assist Channel.
15265 : 1. You are a new player You may post messages from the moment you first set foot in Vana'diel.
15266 : 2. You are a returnee As a returning player, you may post messages upon logging in with a character that has not logged in for at least 48 days.
15267 : 3. You are a mentor You may post messages as long as you remain a mentor to other players.
15268 : New players and returnees may post messages until they have been logged in for a total of 48 hours since first receiving their posting rights.
15269 : If you wish to check how long you can continue to post for, speak to an  and choose "When do my posting rights expire?" to see how much time you have left.
15270 : The Assist Channel can only be used in the following areas.
15271 : Available areas: %, %, %, %, %%
15272 : ...%%%%%%%%
15273 : ...%, %, %, %, %, %, %, %...
15274 : ...%, %, %, and your Mog House (Rent-a-Room).
15275 : You cannot post or read messages outside of the areas listed above.
15276 : Even in areas where messages are allowed, you cannot post consecutive messages. Please wait a while after posting a message.
15277 : Mentor messages are accompanied by a flag () marker. This marker indicates the mentor's reliability (Mentor Class) and experience as an adventurer (Mastery Rank).
15278 : As a mentor's Mentor Class increases, the color and shape of the marker will change:  >  >
15279 : A  marker is a sign that the mentor has earned the highest levels of trust from other adventurers.
15280 : The number affixed to the marker is the mentor's Mastery Rank, and indicates how experienced the mentor is as an adventurer.
15281 : The higher the number, the more experienced the mentor is.
15282 : You can check your own Mastery Rank even if you do not serve as a mentor, so feel free to take a look every now and then if you are curious.
15283 : You can check your Mastery Rank by going to Main Menu > Status > Profile.
15284 : If you wish to speak directly to a mentor, you can search for mentors by going to Main Menu > Help Desk > Mentor Search.
15285 : The Thumbs Up feature enables you to let mentors know when their comments proved to be especially helpful.
15286 : Mentors who earn lots of Thumbs Up replies from other adventurers will see their Mentor Class increase.
15287 : Remember to give a Thumbs Up to any mentor you feel helped you out or taught you something useful.
15288 : A Warning is a feature that can only be used by mentors.
15289 : Please use this feature when a post's contents are insufficient or otherwise may be construed as harassment.
15290 : To send a Thumbs Up or Warning to another player, open the Chat Log Window and move the cursor over the relevant message and press the confirm button (Enter key) to bring up the evaluation menu.
15291 : Evaluations can be made for 10 minutes following the designated player's latest post to the Assist Channel.
15292 : You may send up to one Thumbs Up and one Warning per day (Earth time).
15293 : The Mute feature places restrictions on your ability to post, meaning that other players will be unable to see the messages you post to the Assist Channel.
15294 : Please refrain from posting unsuitable content so that the veteran adventurers are not forced to mute you.
15295 : Mute status can be removed by players that have the necessary Mute List access rights, or it will be removed automatically 24 hours (Earth time) after the mute status was enabled.
15296 : You are free to post messages to the Assist Channel until you decide to stop serving as a mentor.
15297 : You may post messages to the Assist Channel until #:# on #/#/#. (Time remaining: Approx. # [sec./min./hr.])
15298 : If you log out while you still have time available, your remaining time will be carried over to the next time you log in.
15299 : You are about to lose the ability to post messages to the Assist Channel.
15300 : You are unable to post messages to the Assist Channel.
15301 : Take on the % Records of Eminence objective from the Tutorial section of the Records of Eminence Menu and speak to the A.M.A.N. liaison.
15302 : Good day, adventurer! I am able to repair any broken item data related to %.
15303 : If you are unable to deliver %, it's possible that the item data has been corrupted.
15304 : Please trade your % to me so that I may fix it.
15305 : I have confirmed that the item data for your % has been corrupted. We apologize for the inconvenience.
15306 : I have restored it to its intended functionality. Here you are!
15307 : It appears that your item is working as intended.
15308 : An error has occurred. Please try again later.
